column4: hey guys I need a little help, a nice guy from ubuntu-xgl wants to ssh in here... how do I do that?
ok... I pressed space and nothing happened...
right did it clear your screen?
that is what is meant to happen
but I want to let a person who's trying to help me ssh in here...
this just lets you see what he's typing, can never be too secure :)
don't want him to rm -rf /* your hard drive
if it is type apt-get install ssh
I'm newb enought to doesn't understand what multiverse is
sudo /etc/init.d/(the one that sounds SSH like, probably sshd or openssh)
